Timeline.Text: Serbia's Prime Minister Aleksandar Vucic declares victory in the Albanian presidential election.
Ilir Meta wins the Albanian presidential election, receiving 87 votes from 140 assembly members.
Albania's ruling Socialist Party wins the parliamentary election with between 45 and 49 percent of the vote.
France holds its presidential election, with the country deciding between Emmanuel Macron and Marine Le Pen.

Overview.Summary: Ilir Meta, leader of the Socialist Movement for Integration, was elected as the president of Albania on April 28, 2017 (2,6,8). This marked the 10th president in the country's history (7). His candidacy was supported by the ruling majority (9). The election was monitored by an OSCE/ODIHR Election Observation Mission (1).

Timeline.Text: Albania holds parliamentary elections for 140 seats in parliament.
Ilir Meta, leader of the Socialist Movement for Integration, is elected president of Albania by the parliament.
Ilir Meta is confirmed as the 10th president in the history of Albania.
HM King Mohammed VI of Morocco congratulates Ilir Meta on his election as president of Albania.
Ilir Meta meets with Italy's Undersecretary of State for Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation to discuss political developments and bilateral cooperation.
Ilir Meta appeals for calm among Macedonian political parties and condemns anti-Albanian sentiments.

Overview.Summary: The 2017 Albanian presidential election (10) saw the ruling Socialist Party (10) win with 45-49% of the votes (10). The election was held on June 25 (1) and followed a political compromise between parties (4,5,8,9). The opposition parties threatened to boycott the election unless a caretaker cabinet was created (7). The Parliament elected its leader Ilir Meta as the new president (3). The election was initially prompted by protests and boycotts (1).

Timeline.Text: Albania holds snap parliamentary elections.
The opposition parties in Albania threaten to boycott the upcoming parliamentary election.
The opposition parties in Albania demand a caretaker cabinet before participating in the parliamentary election.
The results of Albania's parliamentary election are announced.
The Albanian Parliament approves a government shake-up ahead of the upcoming parliamentary election.
The Albanian Parliament elects Ilir Meta as the country's new president.
The ruling Socialist Party is projected to win the parliamentary election, according to an exit poll.

Overview.Summary: The 2017 Albanian presidential election was held on June 25, 2017 (3). The election took place for 140 seats in the Parliament of Albania (3). Ilir Meta was elected as the President of Albania with 87 votes (10). The election was held using a two-round system and Meta won in the first round (4). The 2017 election was the first round of the French presidential election, which was held on April 2, 2017 (7). The election resulted in a runoff between Emmanuel Macron and Marine Le Pen (8,9). Macron was re-elected as President of France in the second round on April 23, 2017 (6). The election was significant because it shattered the traditional two-party system in France (8).

The first round of the French presidential election takes place, with Emmanuel Macron and Marine Le Pen emerging as the top two candidates.
Macron and Le Pen are confirmed as the final candidates for the French presidential election.
Ilir Meta is elected as the President of Albania, receiving 87 votes from 140 assembly members.

Overview.Summary: The 2017 Albanian presidential election, scheduled for June 25, has been postponed and rescheduled as part of a compromise between political parties (1). The election has been observed by the OSCE (3) and has been a topic of international interest, with French President-elect Emmanuel Macron congratulating the winner (2). The role of the President of Albania has been analyzed in the context of the election (5) and the election has been compared to the Iranian presidential election of 2017 (6). However, the main opposition party has chosen to ignore the election (8) and there have been no visible signs of campaigning on the streets (10).

Timeline.Text: The Albanian presidential election is held, with the main parties beginning their campaigns.
French president-elect Emmanuel Macron wins the presidential election, with Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau congratulating him.
The Iranian presidential election takes place, with six official candidates running for the presidency.
Albania's president sets the date of the parliamentary election, which is later postponed and officially confirmed as a terrorist incident.

Overview.Summary: The 2017 Albanian presidential election is an indirect election (1, 9, 10). The election was held on June 25, 2017 (9) and was monitored by the OSCE/ODIHR (2). The result was announced on June 20, 2017 (1). Similar to the French presidential election (3, 4) and the Iranian presidential election (6, 8), the citizens do not directly elect the president (10). The election was held after a political agreement between the Socialist Party and the Democratic Party (9).

Overview.Summary: The 2017 Albanian presidential election took place on June 25, 2017 (6, 12). Ilir Meta, leader of the Socialist Movement for Integration (LSI), was elected as the new president of Albania (2, 3, 13, 18, 20). The election was initially scheduled for June 18, but was postponed due to political compromise (4). Meta's election was supported by the Italian government (14) and congratulated by King Mohammed VI of Morocco (13). The split between the Socialist Party and the opposition Democratic Party deepened during the election (19). The election was observed by the OSCE and deemed free and fair (1, 12).

Timeline.Text: Ilir Meta, leader of the Socialist Movement for Integration, is elected as the new president of Albania.
HM King Mohammed VI of Morocco sends a message of congratulations to Ilir Meta on his election as President of Albania.
Ilir Meta meets with Italy's Undersecretary of State for Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation to discuss political developments and bilateral cooperation.
Albanians head to the polls for a snap parliamentary election after months of protest and parliamentary boycott by the opposition.
Ilir Meta appeals to Macedonian political parties for calm and condemns anti-Albanian rhetoric in the country.
The OSCE/ODIHR deploys an Election Observation Mission for the June 25, 2017 parliamentary election in Albania.
The six official candidates for the Iranian Presidential election are pre-selected by the Council of Guardians.
The process of indirect elections in Albania is explained.
Albanians vote in the parliamentary election.
Serbian voters elect their next president in a two-round system.
Prime Minister Aleksandar Vucic of Serbia wins the presidential election.
The first-round vote in the French Presidential election takes place.
Emmanuel Macron is re-elected as President of France after defeating Marine Le Pen in the runoff election.
